cluster.name: Prepayment
cluster.description: The Prepayment Cluster provides the facility to pass messages relating to the accounting functionality of a meter between devices on the HAN. It allows for the implementation of a system conforming to the set of standards relating to Payment Electricity Meters (IEC 62055) and also for the case where the accounting function is remote from the meter. Prepayment is used in situations where the supply of a service may be interrupted or enabled under the control of the meter or system in relation to a payment tariff. The accounting process may be within the meter or elsewhere in the system. The amount of available credit is decremented as the service is consumed and is incremented through payments made by the consumer. Such a system allows the consumer to better manage their energy consumption and reduces the risk of bad debt owing to the supplier.

In the case where the accounting process resides within the meter, credit updates are sent to the meter from the ESI. Such messages are out of scope of this cluster. The cluster allows credit status to be made available to other devices on the HAN for example to enable the consumers to view their status on an IHD. It also allows them to select emergency credit if running low and also, where local markets allow, restoring their supply remotely from within the HAN.

command.name: Select Available Emergency Credit
command.description: FIXME: This command is sent to the Metering Device to activate the use of any Emergency Credit available on the Metering Device.

command.name: Change Debt
command.description: FIXME: The ChangeDebt command is send to the Metering Device to change the fuel or Non fuel debt values.

command.name: Emergency Credit Setup
command.description: FIXME: This command is a method to set up the parameters for the emergency credit.

command.name: Consumer Top Up
command.description: FIXME: The ConsumerTopUp command is used by the IPD and the ESI as a method of applying credit top up values to the prepayment meter.

command.name: Credit Adjustment
command.description: FIXME: The CreditAdjustment command is sent to update the accounting base for the Prepayment meter.

command.name: Change Payment Mode
command.description: FIXME: This command is sent to a Metering Device to instruct it to change its mode of operation. i.e. from Credit to Prepayment.

command.name: Get Prepay Snapshot
command.description: FIXME: This command is used to request the cluster server for snapshot data.

command.name: Get Top Up Log
command.description: FIXME: This command is sent to the Metering Device to retrieve the log of Top Up codes received by the meter.

command.name: Set Low Credit Warning Level
command.description: FIXME: This command is sent from client to a Prepayment server to set the warning level for low credit.

command.name: Get Debt Repayment Log
command.description: FIXME: This command is used to request the contents of the repayment log.

command.name: Set Maximum Credit Limit
command.description: FIXME: This command is sent from a client to the Prepayment server to set the maximum credit level allowed in the meter.

command.name: Set Overall Debt Cap
command.description: FIXME: This command is sent from a client to the Prepayment server to set the overall debt cap allowed in the meter.

command.name: Publish Prepay Snapshot
command.description: FIXME: This command is generated in response to a GetPrepaySnapshot command. It is used to return a single snapshot to the client.

command.name: Change Payment Mode Response
command.description: FIXME: This command is send in response to the ChangePaymentMode Command.

command.name: Consumer Top Up Response
command.description: FIXME: This command is send in response to the ConsumerTopUp Command.

command.name: Publish Top Up Log
command.description: FIXME: This command is used to send the Top Up Code Log entries to the client.

command.name: Publish Debt Log
command.description: FIXME: This command is used to send the contents of the Repayment Log.

value.name: Rejected Top Up Value Too Large
